name: places/ChIJ7WH6SEJZwokR7oW4UZALd0I
formattedAddress: Midtown Manhattan, New York, NY 10016, USA
adrFormatAddress: Midtown Manhattan, New York, NY 10016, USA

originalText.text:
I look down at it everyday since it's right outside my apartment window and has been nothing but a vacant enclosed lot that they once in awhile use for when the UN assembles and then they set up tents and such for security etc. I've been here over 5 yrs in this apartment and we keep being told different things as to what will be built there and when. Personally I would love another open park concept to give some space to picnic, exercise, lay out etc. We do not have that luxury on the east side like they do on the west side with the all the parks like little island the redone piers or the man made beach. We have to go across town to bryant park, central park or to what I just mentioned.
I do see the sign even now as I type that says Work in Progress: Alteration The Field of Light of Freedom Plaza. Which looks pretty neat and will be something fun to do.

originalText.text: For everyone interested in the place, there should be high-rise buildings but a permit was revoked as they found underground waters and other factors at this location would not permit to build anything there. The landlord tried to sell but was getting lowballing offers. They decided to keep the land. Now there is one interesting fact about this land. The original permit was issued under Mayor Gulianiâ€™s office. We know Republicans are more easy to go with things like that. In my opinion, landlords just sit and wait if the Republicans come back, they might issue the permit. ðŸ˜Š

originalText.text: The light show wouldâ€™ve been a lot better if they had left the trees. We couldâ€™ve been walking through a forest in the middle of Manhattan.

originalText.text: Freedom Plaza, categorized as a park in New York City, is a complete disappointment. Instead of a beautiful public space, it's nothing more than an enclosed lot controlled by someone with deep pockets. This place does nothing to enhance the city's beauty; it's just a symbol of exclusivity. A true letdown for anyone seeking a genuine park experience.

originalText.text: I didn't know this empty lot that UN doesn't know what to do with is called a FREEDOM PLAZA. This is a contactruction zone not accesable to general public! Would be good to have a real park there, but I think they have some kind of a building for this space in the works!
